title: PSA to all Non-jungle mains.
body:
If, for some god forsaken reason, a member of our team DCs, you need to keep a few things in mind regarding the jungler.

First of all, don't expect heavy presence. For the most part, if a solo lane DCs, I'm usually gonna spend my time clearing camps close to that lane and just straight up playing in that lane. Sucks that you don't have a jungler, but deal.  If the support/adc DCs, expect me to spend my time around there, farming my camps and looking for opportunities to gank mid/bot. Play safe, ward, and don't overextend.

Second of all, if I have to spend the majority of my time camping a lane that has DCd, and you lose lane, you do not, in fact, get to cry and bitch about how I haven't come to save your ass. You knew that my presence was gonna be slim to none, and you shouldn't expect me to be able to help recover your lost lane. If I have to choose between letting zed freefarm mid and going top to try and help you cause you're 0/3 due to your lack of an ability to ward, I'm gonna sit my ass in mid and try and keep zed under control.

I understand that not every single laner out there needs to be told something along these lines, but jesus Christ some of them do.

Also, thank god riot has finally started working on a way to remake games with a DC.

Forget about DCs...You're entitled to NOTHING as a laner.  Your lane pick should be good enough to handle most situations.  Not all...this is League after all...you'll likely die a couple of times in every game on the rift. 

Junglers are like roaming supports that sometimes earn the ability to carry a game.  But you're entitled to nothing.  

You want to blame another player for your shit performance or for getting counter picked?  Tough cookies.  Become mechanically superior so there's no such thing as a counter to your champ.  Losing lane despite an even matchup?  Practice your lane and champ more.  

Blaming the jungler (regardless of the circumstance) is a fruitless endeavor in which no one wins.
do you feel better now?

A little.  Thanks for asking. 

In all seriousness, I have a lot of pent up rebuttals from countless games where someone inevitably blames one of the supporting roles.  It really does get old quickly

If im jungler and a mid or top disconnects, i automatically take over the lane.

Letting the enemy free farm, get turrets or roam is a no-go.
Especially a Nasus :U

Keep in mind this can (will) backfire badly, there's many jungle champions who are junglers merely because they can't lane for shit (Xin, Amumu, Yi, Sej) and any strong laner will push them out or kill them. 

A jungler in a lane is at an xp disadvantage, gold disadvantage, summoner spell disadvantage and often matchup disadvantage due to the design of many jungle champions, they should play it safe, let the other guy farm and merely protect tower.

When I tp bot as a toplaner and my jungle goes to my lane to hold the line while I'm gone, if they get overaggressive and die it sets me behind by a LOT.

I find at any elo laners are actually afraid to fight against the jungler when they're in lane. Now, I'm not saying this is the correct way to go about it. If the jungler is there, they are weaker than you. However, the reason they usually just trade farm is because a jungler's presence is extremely variable, and chunking a jungler at the cost of your own HP usually isn't worth it. The jungler can still farm the jungle perfectly fine, but if you're at an HP disadvantage for free in lane you can get bullied hard.

And on the same token junglers often overestimate their own power against the laners in a 1v1. In nearly every situation a laner will run from a jungler. So the jungler isn't used to taking heat as well as giving it and they are often taken off guard at how much damage minions do combined with a higher level champion.

It's a give-and-take situation that can't be grouped into one situation as "this is the go-to response no matter what." Each situation is different and should be treated as such.

TL;DR I said literally nothing but each situation is different. You're welcome.

Why do junglers create such obvious PSAs on the boards? The majority of us would logically conclude the message in every one of these past "PSA" boards this year.

The people that chew you out for not ganking their lane when it's constantly pushed up or not ganking because of DC are the kind of people that blame others for everything. They're never going to see anybody else as anything but wrong. You will never get through to those people, ever. Anytime they die it's because a teammate didn't follow up with something. 

It's the way things are.

The jungler role is the most popular role in the game. So many people play that role, and so many people think they can do things better because that's just how MOBAs are. The same type of person you're complaining about is probably upvoting this thread.

I'm also glad about Riot's changes to DCs, but these threads never feel productive and sometimes they're a bit cringey.
